[Groovy] Class FASTA

java.lang.Object
  FASTA

class FASTA

Simple utilities for manipulating FASTA files.

Note: only indexed files are supported

The core function for this class is to make it easy to read index FASTA files and retrieve sequences of bases corresponding to regions of the genome: 

 println "The bases at chr1:1000-2000 are " + 
      new FASTA("test.fa").basesAt("chr1", 1000,2000)
The above will return the bases as a String object which is inefficient: firstly because the internal representation is bytes, so a conversion must run to turn those into a String object, and secondly because Strings use wide chars (16 bits) for each character. So if you care a lot about efficiency you should use the byte version: 
 println "The bases at chr1:1000-2000 are " + 
      new FASTA("test.fa").basesBytesAt("chr1", 1000,2000)
Authors:
simon.sadedin@mcri.edu.au

Iterates over the ranges in the BED file and extracts the bases for the ranges, passing the bases of the sequence as a byte array to the given closure for each range.

Method Detail

baseBytesAt

byte[] baseBytesAt(java.lang.String contig, long start, long end)
Returns the sequence of bases over the given range NOTE:The range is inclusive.
Parameters:
contig - contig to query
start - start position (inclusive)
end - end position (inclusive)
Returns:
bytes representing the bases in the range, corresponding to ascii codes of DNA symbols (A = 65, etc.)

java.lang.String basesAt(java.lang.String contig, long start, long end)
Returns the sequence of bases over the given range NOTE:The range is inclusive.
Parameters:

start - start position (inclusive)
end - end position (inclusive)
Returns:

bracket

static java.lang.String bracket(java.lang.String seq, int position)
Display given sequence with a single base bracketed to highlight it
Parameters:
seq - sequence to display
start - position to start from (inclusive)
Returns:
sequence with specified base bracketed

bracket

static java.lang.String bracket(java.lang.String seq, int start, int end)
Display given sequence with given bases bracketed
Parameters:
seq - sequence to display
start - position to start from (inclusive)
end - position to end at (exclusive)
Returns:
sequence with specified bases bracketed

eachSequence

@CompileStatic
void eachSequence(Closure c)
Iterates over the FASTA and calls the given closure for each reference sequence (eg: chromosome) passing the bases of the sequence as a byte array

eachSequence

@CompileStatic
void eachSequence(BED bed, Closure c)
Iterates over the ranges in the BED file and extracts the bases for the ranges, passing the bases of the sequence as a byte array to the given closure for each range.

format

@CompileStatic
static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String contig, java.lang.String sequence)

reverseComplement

@CompileStatic
static java.lang.String reverseComplement(java.lang.String bases)
Compute the reverse complement of the given sequence of bases.

NOTE: this method understands IUPAC codes.

NOTE 2: The complement of 'N' is returned as 'N'.

Parameters:
bases - Sequence of bases to compute reverse complement for
Returns:
the given bases, reversed and converted to their DNA complement.
